Graph

Class Node3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • Graph.Node
      • Graph.Node3D

  • public class Node3D
extends Node
    Extends the class Node in a way that Nodes can be positioned in 3 dimensional space. It provides functions for projecting those 3 dimensional coordinates onto a 2D plane. This plane is determined by the two vectors X and Y (which are always normal to each other) and the origin of the coordinate system. This plane can also be rotated in different directions. When such a projection is done, also the distance of the point two the specified 2D plane is stored.
    Version:
    1.0.2, 23rd June 2019
    Author:
    Lukas Wögerer

      • getDistance

        public double getDistance()

      • project3DPoints

        public static void project3DPoints(Graph G)
        Projects the 3D point onto a 2D plane determined by the two vectors X and Y (which are always normal to each other) and the origin of the coordinate system. This projection will be stored inside the 2D positions of the nodes. It also calculates for each node the distance to the specified 2D plane. Positions on the 2D plane are scaled such that all 2D coordinates of the nodes lie within the unit square.
        Parameters:
        G - A Graph

      • rotate

        public static void rotate(java.lang.String c,
                          Graph G)
        Rotates the 2D plane specified by the two vectors X and Y (which are always normal to each other) and the origin of the coordinate system. It also recalculates all positions of all nodes relative to the new 2D plane.
        Parameters:
        c - Keyboard symbol that got hit
        G - A Graph

      • scale

        public static void scale(Graph G)
        Positions on the 2D plane are scaled such that all 2D coordinates of the nodes lie within the unit square.
        Parameters:
        G - A Graph
